intro: Korthalsella taenioides f. disticha, commonly known as the double-flowered korthalsella, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences. The plant features two rows of flowers along its elongated spikes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens.
